meanings.definition: A person who constructs or builds something.
meanings.sent1: The framer built a sturdy house for the family.
meanings.sent2: The skilled framer constructed a beautiful wooden table.
meanings.sent3: The framer decided to build a house out of chocolate, but it melted in the sun.
meanings.sent4: She was the framer of dreams, turning ideas into reality.
meanings.sent5: The framer's hands worked tirelessly, shaping the future one brick at a time.

meanings.definition: A person who designs or plans something.
meanings.sent1: The framer carefully planned the layout of the new park.
meanings.sent2: As a framer, she created intricate blueprints for the skyscraper.
meanings.sent3: The framer's plan to build a rollercoaster in the backyard raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: He was the framer of success, mapping out each step to achieve his goals.
meanings.sent5: The framer's vision transformed the barren land into a bustling cityscape.

meanings.definition: A person who frames a picture or artwork.
meanings.sent1: The framer carefully selected the perfect frame for the painting.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the best framer in town for her elegant framing choices.
meanings.sent3: The framer accidentally framed a photo of a potato instead of the family portrait.
meanings.sent4: His hands moved with precision, like a framer framing a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The framer's touch added a touch of magic to the artwork, enhancing its beauty.

meanings.definition: A person who sets up or establishes something.
meanings.sent1: The framer established a new record for the fastest marathon time.
meanings.sent2: As a framer of policies, she implemented changes for the betterment of society.
meanings.sent3: The framer set up a lemonade stand on the moon, but there were no customers.
meanings.sent4: He was the framer of innovation, laying the foundation for groundbreaking ideas.
meanings.sent5: The framer's actions laid the groundwork for a brighter future for generations to come.
